messages.content: I want a monthly spending plan

Let's get your monthly spending plan off to a great start!
- Your plan aims for 50% on Needs, 30% on Wants, and 20% for Savings. This is a great framework to follow.
- A good goal this month is to set up a detailed budget. This will help you track where your money goes.
- Consider starting a monthly investment (SIP) with 10-15% of your income. Even a small start is impactful.
- Prioritize building an emergency fund to cover 3-6 months of essential expenses. This will give you financial peace of mind.
- Review all your subscriptions and try cooking at home more often. These small changes can really add up.

Great starting point! Let's build a solid financial plan together.
- Aim for about 50-55% of your take-home pay for essential Needs, 20-25% for Wants, and at least 20-25% for Savings & Investments.
- Once you have steady income, try to start investing INR 5,000-10,000 monthly into simple funds.
- Start tracking all your spending closely to see where your money goes. This helps you understand your habits.
- Also, begin building an emergency fund to cover 3-6 months of your essential expenses.
- Review your subscriptions and consider cooking at home more often to save extra cash.
